sub_title: Senior Humanitarian and Development Advisor at Upinion
summary:
Skilled researcher with more than 15 years experience in both quantitative and qualitative research methods, including knowledge of Planning, Monitoring and Evaluation (PME). 

Currently, working as a senior advisor at Upinion and also a fellow at the Edmund Hillary Fellowship. 

Responsible for the development of the ‘Forced migrants and Sexual and Reproductive Health and Rights (SRHR)’ programme at the international department of Rutgers. In this programme, I am also project leader for various projects in humanitarian settings. 

In addition, I have built considerable evidence in establishing strategic partnerships and writing successful project proposals. Throughout my career I have demonstrated a keen ability to connect the academic world with the field. 

Powerful public speaker.

Tijdens deze werkconferentie presenteert promovenda Pinar Okur (INTERVICT, Tilburg University) de resultaten uit haar onderzoek naar seksueel geweldservaringen onder kinderen en jongeren met een niet-westerse achtergrond. Deze thema-competentie omgaan met seksualiteit, seksueel risicogedrag en seksueel misbruik is in co-creatie met vertegenwoordigers uit het werkveld en de HSAO (Hoger Sociaal Agogisch Onderwijs) ontwikkeld als aanvulling op het uitstroomprofiel Jeugdzorgwerker.
